challenges.title: Introduction to Basic HTML
description: You will now be learning HTML, the language of the web.

HTML is a language for making documents.

It uses special symbols (codes) for describing a document.

For example, there are different codes to indicate a heading, a paragraph, or a list.

HTML is a 'Markup Language' which uses annotations to give information to text.

It also gives structure to the 'User Interface' or what you see on a web page.

challenges.title: Documentation for HTML
description: You will need documentation for HTML.

A great place to look for word definitions is in Wikipedia.
You can quickly look up the words HTML, Markup Language and other terms.

Always look up words or terms you do not know.
Such as 'markup language' or 'hypertext'.

Usually wikipedia will be at the top of the search results on Google for most terms.
However you can always add the word wiki or wikipedia to any search.

Try it out. Use this search on Google:
html wikipedia

The best documentation for HTML is found on the Mozilla Developer Network (MDN).
You can add the word MDN to any search to find the document on the MDN.

Try it out. Use this search on Google:
p mdn

The official specification for HTML is found at the W3C website.
These docs have all the information about HTML but are generally harder to read than the MDN.

Checkout the W3C website by searching for:
w3c html 5

challenges.title: ** Read Beginning HTML And CSS 1 through 6
description:
It is recommended that you read the chapters 1 through 6 of the book:

Beginning HTML And CSS

by Rob Larsen

You may find a free pdf or html version of the book online.
You can search Google for a pdf version of the book by including the words 'pdf'.
Please commit to reading chapters 1 through 6 before you reach the CSS lessons.
